bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, March 15, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D APR 25 '01 DEPT OF STATE.

div1.p: No. 66. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, March 15, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. A Concession granted to the Afro-American Steamship and Mining Company of Boston.
Synopsis. The Liberian Government grants a Concession to a company of colored men of Boston to establish a Steamship, Mining and Railway Company in Grand Bassa County Liberia.
No. 66. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia; March 15, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transit herewith, the intelligence, that the Liberian Government, has recently granted a Concession, to a Boston company of colored men; represented here by the recent arrival of our Charles P. Weeks, as agent; known as The Afro-American Steamship and Mining Company, of Boston, conceding to said Company the night to established a Steamship Company to operate between Boston and

and Liberia, to erect whereas, and build ; rail and tram ways; and to carry on a system of Mining opperations, for a period of Fifty gear. The Company, however, is to pay the Liberian Government, a consideration of Ten Thousand Dollars, for there special privileges.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, Consul General.
Inclosure. Liberia Recorder Feb'y 28, 1901.
The Liberia Recorder
"VIVAT RESPUBLICA."
Vol. III. No. 24. MONROVIA, Thursday, February 28, 1901. Price 8c.
"The Liberia Recorder" IS PUBLISHED IN MONROVIA. LIBERIA, WEST COAST OF AFRICA, On the 2nd and 4th Thursdays of each month.
At One Dollar and Seventy-five cents per annum, payable in advance, and is sent to any part of the world on the payment of 25c extra for postage.
ALL COMMUNICATIONS for publication or otherwise must be addressed to the Editor "The Liberia Recorder."
C. D. B. KING, . . . . . . Editor.
ASSISTING EDITORS: T. W. HOWARD, Jr., and THE REV. N. H. B. CASSELL.
BUSINESS MANAGER: J. W. N. HOUSTON.

AGENTS: Brewerville--W. B. Gant, Esq. Arthington--W. F. Moore, Esq. White Plains--H. T. Wesley, Esq. Cape Mount--J. B. Watson, Esq. Grand Bassa--Hon. J. D. Summerville. Sinoe--Hon. Z. B. Roberts, C. J. Cape Palmas--J. W. N. Thomson, Esq. Sierra-Leone--W. J. Ashley, Esq. Lagos--Hon. Sam'l Leigh, Liberian Consul. Liverpool--Hon. Ellis Edwards, Liberian Consul. New York--Hon. A. W. Minick, Liberian Consul.
